Sensitively detect cfRNA - RARE-seq

  1. Home
  2. News
  3. Frontiers
  4. Human genomics
Disclaimer: This post does not represent a publication by XinLab. Instead, we are sharing research progress that we find intriguing. Please note that our interpretations reflect our current perspective and may not be entirely accurate. We welcome your feedback‚Äîif you believe any part of this content is inappropriate for our website, please let us know.

April 16, 2025

In a recent Nature paper, an improved sequencing method to more sensitively detect cell-free RNA was reported.

Sensitively detect cfRNA - RARE-seq

‚ú® Methodological Innovations

üî¨ Optimized cfRNA Analysis Workflow

RARE-seq is a refined method for cfRNA analysis, encompassing the entire workflow‚Äîfrom plasma sample processing, cfRNA extraction, and library preparation to high-throughput sequencing. This method is designed to significantly enhance the sensitivity of ctRNA detection.

ü©∏ Addressing Platelet Contamination

For the first time, RARE-seq reveals the substantial impact of platelet contamination on cfRNA analysis. A computational approach was developed to effectively remove platelet RNA interference, ensuring more accurate detection of non-platelet-derived gene expression.

üéØ Targeted Capture of Low-Abundance Genes

Innovatively designed to target and capture rare or absent transcripts (RAGs) in healthy individuals‚Äô plasma, RARE-seq facilitates efficient detection of genes originating from non-hematopoietic tissues‚Äîproviding a powerful tool for identifying cancer-specific and organ-specific genes.

üöÄ Technical Advantages

üîç High Sensitivity

Compared to traditional whole-transcriptome RNA sequencing, RARE-seq enhances sensitivity in detecting tumor-derived cfRNA by approximately 50-fold, with a detection limit as low as 0.05%. This allows for the identification of minuscule amounts of tumor-related cfRNA in the bloodstream with remarkable precision.

üéØ Exceptional Specificity

RARE-seq effectively distinguishes tumor-derived cfRNA from background cfRNA, reducing false-positive results and improving detection accuracy.

üõ† Robust Noise Resistance

By optimizing experimental procedures and computational methods, RARE-seq successfully eliminates platelet contamination and background noise, enhancing signal clarity and result reliability.

üî¨ Broad Applicability

RARE-seq is not limited to cancer detection‚Äîit also shows promising potential in tissue origin identification, therapy resistance monitoring, and evaluation of non-malignant diseases.

üîë Key Findings

üß™ Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Detection

Among 437 plasma samples, RARE-seq efficiently detects NSCLC transcriptional signatures. Detection sensitivity increases with tumor progression, reaching 83% sensitivity and 95% specificity in stage IV patients‚Äîoutperforming initial circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) analysis.

üìå Tissue Origin Identification

Analysis of pancreatic, prostate, and liver cancer patients validates RARE-seq‚Äôs effectiveness across multiple cancer types. With an 89% accuracy rate, it provides a powerful tool for determining the tissue origin of malignancies.

üî¨ Therapy Resistance Monitoring

In NSCLC patients harboring EGFR mutations, RARE-seq successfully detects histological transformations and mutation-based resistance mechanisms, equipping clinicians with a more comprehensive understanding of therapy resistance.

ü©∫ Non-Malignant Disease Assessment

RARE-seq identifies lung-derived cfRNA expression in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), active COVID-19 infection, and intensive care unit (ICU) admissions, demonstrating its potential for assessing non-malignant lung conditions.

üí° Clinical Applications

üîé Early Cancer Screening

With its high sensitivity, RARE-seq holds promise for early cancer detection, particularly for small tumors that are challenging to identify through conventional imaging methods.

üè• Tissue Origin Identification

For patients with unknown primary tumors or those requiring cancer subtype differentiation, RARE-seq enables non-invasive tumor tissue identification‚Äîenhancing clinical diagnostic precision.

üíä Therapy Monitoring & Prognostic Evaluation

By tracking ctRNA changes in real-time, RARE-seq facilitates the early detection of therapy resistance mechanisms, allowing for timely adjustments to personalized treatment plans.

ü©∫ Non-Malignant Disease Assessment

RARE-seq aids in monitoring tissue damage and inflammation, evaluating disease activity, and treatment response‚Äîoffering a new perspective for diagnosing and managing non-malignant diseases.

ü¶† RNA Vaccine Tracking

RARE-seq enables simultaneous tracking of vaccine RNA and host immune response in individuals vaccinated with mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccines, providing valuable insights for RNA vaccine development and application.
